newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Oce says engineering segment sales up.
newsitem.headline: Oce says engineering segment sales up.

text.p: Photocopier maker Oce-van der Grinten NV said on Monday sales in the engineering systems market increased by 15 percent to 1.37 billion guilders in the 1995/96 year to November 30.

"This growth is chiefly attributable to the large number of placements of digital copiers/printers for the high volume segment (Oce 9800) and the similarly digital Oce 9400 family for the low and medium segments," it said.
It said digital machines represented more than 70 percent of sales in the engineering systems market. Oce earlier announced a 57 percent rise in year profit to 169.5 million guilders.
Excluding exchange rate effects, the rise was 12 percent.
Oce said sales in the office systems market, including Oce printers, increased by 19 percent to 2.08 billion guilders, or 16 percent when currency effects are excluded.
"In this market, Oce achieved good results, specifically in the medium, high and very high volume segments for analogue copiers," the company said.
"In printing systems, excellent results were also achieved with the Oce network printers (Oce 9200 family)," it added.
Sales of the acquired SNI Printing activities were 731 million guilders for the April 1-November 30 period.
The main SNI activities are its Pagestream printers with speeds of up to 700 pages per minute.
Oce said total assets grew by 1.3 billion guilders or almost 40 percent to 4.6 billion over the year, with SNI Printing accounting for 800 million of this.
Of the remaining 500 million guilders of the increase, 300 million came from the increase in financial leases and rented copiers.
Oce shares were unchanged at 241.0 guilders in early trading.
